page.title: 04Mentmore:new homes from old
page.content: Next comes a small bungalow, converted from stables, and a late Victorian dwelling, formerly the Vicarage. On a ridge opposite stands the small grey stone church dating from about 1200 A.D., the living shared with Cheddington. Overlooking the churchyard is Church Cottage which predates the Rothschilds and ajoins the stable block, now converted to a Craft Centre. Next is the house built for Baron Meyer de Rothschild to live in while the mansion was being constructed, now converted to three dwellings. Reaching the village green on the left, we find the main entrance to Mentmore Towers on the right, with a block of three houses, formerly the laundry for the mansion. Inside the ornate wrought-iron gates is Stone Lodge.
